iteration_goal: This first increment focuses on building the foundational components for the Quran Secrets Analyzer. It involves creating two Python modules: `quran_data_loader.py` to load Quran data from the specified text file into a list of dictionaries, and `quran_search.py` to implement a basic function that searches for a given word within the loaded Quran text.  A pytest test case `test_search_allah_word` is also included to verify the basic word search functionality for the word 'Allah'. This step ensures the application can read the Quran data and perform a simple search, setting the stage for more advanced features in subsequent iterations.

This increment focuses on enhancing the Quran Secrets Analyzer by adding the capability to search for word groups (phrases). A new function `search_word_group` will be implemented in `quran_search.py` to find exact word sequences within the Quran text.  A new pytest test case `test_search_word_group` will be created to validate this functionality, ensuring the application can now search for phrases in addition to individual words. This step expands the search capabilities and prepares the ground for more complex analyses in future iterations.

This increment enhances the search functionality of the Quran Secrets Analyzer by adding case-insensitive search capability to both `search_word` and `search_word_group` functions.  This allows users to search for words and phrases regardless of letter case. Existing and new test cases will be updated to ensure the correct functionality of both case-sensitive and case-insensitive search modes. This improvement makes the search feature more flexible and user-friendly.

This increment focuses on adding the functionality to search for a specific word within a particular Surah (chapter) of the Quran. A new function `search_word_in_surah` will be implemented in `quran_search.py` to enable this feature.  A corresponding pytest test case `test_search_word_in_surah` will be created to validate the functionality, ensuring accurate and case-insensitive searches within specified Surahs. This enhancement allows for more targeted analysis of Quranic text.

This increment focuses on enhancing the Quran Secrets Analyzer by enabling users to search for specific word groups (phrases) within a particular Surah (chapter) of the Quran.  A new function `search_word_group_in_surah` will be added to `quran_search.py` to facilitate this.  Correspondingly, a new pytest test case `test_search_word_group_in_surah` will be created to validate the functionality, ensuring accurate and case-insensitive (and optionally case-sensitive) searches for phrases within specified Surahs. This feature expands the search precision and allows for more targeted analysis of Quranic text by chapter.

This increment adds the functionality to count the total occurrences of a specific word in the entire Quran. A new function `count_word_occurrences` will be implemented in `quran_search.py` and tested using pytest. This feature will allow for analyzing word frequency across the entire Quranic text, providing a new dimension for secret analysis.

This increment focuses on adding the capability to count the total occurrences of a specific word group (phrase) within the entire Quran. A new function `count_word_group_occurrences` will be implemented in `quran_search.py`.  A corresponding pytest test case `test_count_word_group_occurrences` will be created to validate this functionality. This feature expands the analytical capabilities of the Quran Secrets Analyzer, allowing for frequency analysis of phrases across the entire Quranic text.

This increment focuses on adding the capability to search for a specific word within a defined range of verses in the Quran. A new function `search_word_in_verse_range` will be implemented in `quran_search.py` to enable this feature.  A corresponding pytest test case `test_search_word_in_verse_range` will be created to validate the functionality. This enhancement allows for more focused and targeted analysis of Quranic text by allowing users to specify verse ranges for their searches.

This increment focuses on enhancing the Quran Secrets Analyzer by adding the capability to search for specific word groups (phrases) within a defined range of verses in the Quran. A new function `search_word_group_in_verse_range` will be implemented in `quran_search.py` to enable this feature.  A corresponding pytest test case `test_search_word_group_in_verse_range` will be created to validate the functionality. This enhancement allows for more focused and targeted analysis of Quranic text by allowing users to specify verse ranges for their phrase searches.

This increment focuses on adding the functionality to search for verses based on the number of words they contain. A new function `search_verses_by_word_count` will be implemented in `quran_search.py` to enable searching for verses with a specific word count. A corresponding pytest test case `test_search_verses_by_word_count` will be created to validate this new functionality. This feature allows for exploring potential numerical patterns within the Quranic verses by analyzing verse lengths.

This final increment adds the capability to search for Quran verses where the word count is a multiple of a specified number. A new function `search_verses_by_word_count_multiple` is implemented in `quran_search.py`, along with a corresponding pytest test case `test_search_verses_by_word_count_multiple`. This feature enables advanced numerical analysis of Quranic verses, allowing users to explore patterns related to multiples of numbers, such as 19, potentially revealing hidden mathematical structures or secrets within the Quranic text. This completes the feature set for the Quran Secrets Analyzer as per the final product goal.

Implement a function `calculate_gematrical_value` in `quran_search.py` to calculate the gematrical value of Arabic words or phrases. Add a pytest test case `test_calculate_gematrical_value` to validate the function. This feature supports numerical analysis of Quranic text.

Implement a function `search_words_by_gematrical_value` in `quran_search.py` to search for words in the Quran that match a given gematrical value. Add a pytest test case to validate this functionality. This feature enables searching for words based on their numerical values, enhancing numerical analysis capabilities.

Implement `search_word_groups_by_gematrical_value` in `quran_search.py` to find word groups in the Quran whose gematrical value matches a given target value. Create a corresponding pytest test case `test_search_word_groups_by_gematrical_value` to validate this functionality. This feature enables searching for phrases based on their numerical values, further enhancing the numerical analysis capabilities of the Quran Secrets Analyzer.

This increment focuses on adding the functionality to calculate the total gematrical value of a specified Surah in the Quran. A new function `calculate_surah_gematrical_value` will be implemented in `quran_search.py` to compute this value by summing the gematrical values of all words within the Surah. A corresponding pytest test case `test_calculate_surah_gematrical_value` will be created to ensure the accuracy of this new feature. This enhancement allows for analyzing the numerical significance of entire Quranic chapters.

Implement `calculate_verse_range_gematrical_value` function in `quran_search.py` to calculate the total gematrical value of a specified range of verses. Create a corresponding pytest test case `test_calculate_verse_range_gematrical_value` in `test_quran_search.py` to validate the functionality. This feature enables numerical analysis of specific verse ranges within the Quran.

This increment adds the final gematrical value calculation feature to the Quran Secrets Analyzer. It involves implementing a function `calculate_quran_gematrical_value` in `quran_search.py` to compute the total gematrical value of the entire Quran by summing the gematrical values of all words across all verses. A pytest test case `test_calculate_quran_gematrical_value` will be created to ensure the accuracy of this function. This completes the gematrical analysis capabilities.

Implement `count_word_occurrences_in_surah` function in `quran_search.py` to count word occurrences within a specific Surah. Create `test_count_word_occurrences_in_surah` in `test_quran_search.py` to validate the new function. This feature enables analysis of word frequency within specific Quran chapters.

Implement `count_word_group_occurrences_in_surah` function in `quran_search.py` to count phrase occurrences within a specific Surah. Create `test_count_word_group_occurrences_in_surah` in `test_quran_search.py` to validate the new function. This feature enables analysis of phrase frequency within specific Quran chapters.

Implement `count_word_occurrences_in_verse_range` function in `quran_search.py` to count occurrences of a specific word within a given verse range. Create a corresponding pytest test case `test_count_word_occurrences_in_verse_range` to validate the function. This allows for focused word frequency analysis in specific Quran sections.

This increment focuses on adding a new search capability to the Quran Secrets Analyzer: searching for verses based on whether their word count is a multiple of a given number. This is achieved by implementing the `search_verses_by_word_count_multiple` function in `quran_search.py` and creating a corresponding pytest test case `test_search_verses_by_word_count_multiple` in `test_quran_search.py`. This feature allows for exploring potential numerical patterns and secrets related to multiples of numbers within the Quranic verses.

This increment adds a new search function `search_word_at_position` to `quran_search.py`. This function allows users to find verses where a specific word appears at a particular position within the verse. For example, users can search for verses where 'Allah' is the first word. A new test case `test_search_word_at_position` is also created to ensure the correct functionality of this new feature.

This increment focuses on implementing the `search_word_group_at_position` function in `quran_search.py`. This new function will allow users to search for verses where a specific word group (phrase) starts at a given position within the verse.  A corresponding pytest test case `test_search_word_group_at_position` will be created to validate this functionality, ensuring accurate searches for phrases at specific positions in Quranic verses. This feature enhances the precision of verse searching by considering the positional context of word groups.

This increment focuses on adding a new search capability to the Quran Secrets Analyzer.  A new function, `search_verses_by_word_gematrical_value_equals_word_count`, will be implemented to search for verses where the gematrical value of a specific word is equal to the number of words in the verse. This feature combines gematrical value calculation and word count analysis to enable more complex searches for potential Quranic secrets. A new pytest test case will be created to ensure the correct functionality.

This increment introduces a new search function to the Quran Secrets Analyzer: `search_verses_by_word_group_gematrical_value_equals_word_count`. This function identifies verses where the gematrical value of a specified word group is equal to the number of words in the verse. This feature extends the analytical capabilities by combining gematrical value calculation for word groups with verse word count analysis. A new test case will be implemented to ensure the function works correctly for both case-sensitive and case-insensitive searches.

This increment adds a new search function `search_verses_by_word_gematrical_value_equals_verse_number` to `quran_search.py`. This function finds verses where the gematrical value of a given word is equal to the verse number. A new test case is also created to validate this functionality. This feature enhances the numerical analysis capabilities of the Quran Analyzer by allowing users to search for verses based on this specific numerical relationship.

This increment adds the `search_verses_by_word_group_gematrical_value_equals_verse_number` function to `quran_search.py`. This function searches for Quran verses where the gematrical value of a given word group is equal to the verse number.  A new pytest test case `test_search_verses_by_word_group_gematrical_value_equals_verse_number` is also required to validate this functionality, including case-sensitive and case-insensitive searches. This feature expands the numerical analysis capabilities for word groups in relation to verse numbers.

This increment introduces the `search_verses_by_word_gematrical_value_equals_surah_number` function to `quran_search.py`. This function enhances the Quran Analyzer by enabling searches for verses where the gematrical value of a specific word matches the verse's Surah number. A new pytest test case is also required to validate this functionality, ensuring accurate results for both case-sensitive and case-insensitive searches. This feature expands the numerical analysis capabilities by exploring relationships between word gematrical values and Surah numbers.
